result.execSummary:
The defendant Devine E. Mendoza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Devine E. Mendoza is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Devine E. Mendoza was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs to be paid in installments of $50.00 per month commencing 11-01-2022 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devine E. Mendoza

records.addlTxt: 2:06 PM Scheduled for AIA.  Defendant Devine E. Mendoza appeared by zoom technology by phone with Attorney Nicholis J Schroeder by video.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Ms. Mendoza previously appeared and was informed of her charges and rights.  Defendant has no questions.  Mr. Schroeder requests to be placed in breakout room as received an offer.  Off record 2:07 p.m.  Back on the record at 2:11 PM.  Mr. Schroeder informs there is an agreement but don't have the plea paperwork completed if court wishes to proceed without it.  The agreement - Plea to count 2 as repeater, $50 fine + costs and dismiss count 2.  Court advises of right to appear in person.  Defendant agrees to proceed by zoom.  Court advises of charges in count 2 OAR/max. penalties as repeater/penalties and advises of constitutional rights.  Defendant US citizen.  Defendant agrees prior conviction.  Mr. Schroeder stipulate factual basis for plea.  Court finds factual basis for plea and Ms. Mendoza will KVI waive constitutional rights.  To count 2 defendant pleads guilty.  Court accepts plea, find you guilty, assess $50 + costs total $516.  No other consequences.  TTP $50/mo. com. 11/1/2022.  Advised of appeal rights.  Count 1 dismissed as part of plea agreement.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:34 PM Defendant Devine E. Mendoza appeared by video from the Clark County Jail with Attorney Schroeder from PD office by video.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  SPD trying to get her representation.  Defendant will be at the Clark County Jail for the next hearing.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:05 PM Defendant Devine E. Mendoza appeared by video from the Clark County Jail.  Attorney Ryan Ramond appeared by video for SPD.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Court reviewed charges, penalties and rights. State requests $500 signature bond.  There was a previous proceeding on 6/6 where a signature bond was ordered.  That bond remain in place.  Mr. Menodza needs to contact the PD office to get qualified.  She does have a PD in Clark County.  We will send notice to the Clark County Jail.  If you are released, be sure you appear on zoom call.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court's response to DA's letter - quash warrant and reschedule
Letter from DA re- schedule new initial appearance

2:05 PM Defendant Devine E. Mendoza not in court.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared on 6/6/22 and was given a new court date of today at 1:30 pm.  Warrant requested by the State and authorized by the Court.
Initial appearance on July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Not operate motor vehicle without being properly licensed

01:32 PM Defendant Devine E. Mendoza appeared by video means by zoom from the Pepin County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to appear by video.  This is a bail hearing only and we will set it and get another hearing.  State informs of charges, standard penalties.  Ms. Mendoza has a significant criminal history and these are non felony, think signature bond appropriate and ask for $2500 signature bond and allow her to be taken back to Marathon County to take care of issues.  Any other conditions other than normal conditions?  Not operate motor vehicle without being properly licensed.  So ordered.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
